Getting started with Google Apps Script

June 20, 2020

So Iâ€™ve just started working with Google Apps Script.

Google Apps Script is a Javascript based programming language that seemlessly links to google docs.

Iâ€™m creating a tool to update a googlesheet based on information entered into other googlesheets - ideally itâ€™ll save some time as before the updates were done manually every day.

Iâ€™m relatively new to Javascript and I am brand new to Google Apps Script. Thankfully thereâ€™s plenty of help online. For general Javascript help check out the following:

  • w3schools provides a huge amount of training materials
  • StackOverflow never fails to disappoint to answer every weird and wonderful question

And Google has written some comprehensive documentation here. You find that Google has created objects and methods for all the Google linked tools (docs, googlesheets, calendar, mail, etc.).

So a few notes from me.

Firstly, get started you can visit here or create a new script by right clicking in your google drive, selecting More and then Google Apps Script.

Then youâ€™ll be working on Googles IDE (Interactive Development Environment). Itâ€™s pretty basic, but it does the job and the code runs nice and quick for me.

First thing to note is that you need to used a log file for print statements as a console doesnâ€™t exist:

    Logger.log("I am a bit slow!");

To view the log file, click View and then Logs. These are quite slow to appear! ðŸ˜”

So Iâ€™ve used it for a day and it has worked great. If you find yourself working on google documents then definitely consider automating your work with Google Apps Scripts!
